notes.claim: Outlines ordinarily do not require APA formatting; only follow APA if the assignment specifies it as grading criteria (including Title page and References).
notes.support: Because outlines are not published works, they do not ordinarily require APA formatting. However, assignment instructions can include APA as a grading criteria... use APA standards for formatting (Title page) and use of sources (References).

notes.claim: APA style does not specify any formatting for outlines since APA is intended for published texts and academic essays.
notes.support: APA style does not require any specific formatting for outlines because APA style is intended for published texts and academic essays.

notes.claim: An outline is a drafting tool that helps plan a paper and provides structure for sections and/or paragraphs depending on project scope.
notes.support: An outline is a drafting tool to help you plan your paper. An outline provides structure for the sections and/or paragraphs of your paper, depending on the scope of your project.

notes.claim: An outline should show the progression of the thesis and can be organized paragraph-by-paragraph using research support.
notes.support: An outline should illustrate the progression of your thesis statement... you can use support from your research to outline your paper, paragraph by paragraph.

notes.claim: Each paragraph should begin with a debatable claim/main idea, and claims build on one another to develop the essay’s argument.
notes.support: Every paragraph... should begin with a claim/main idea, which will be a debatable assertion or position that requires support. Claims build off one another in order to develop an argument over the course of an essay.

notes.claim: Every claim must be supported by evidence, usually from sources (e.g., peer-reviewed journal articles) such as facts, data, statistics, or anecdotes.
notes.support: Every claim should be supported by evidence or support... Evidence and support usually come from other sources, like peer-reviewed journal articles. This can include facts, data, statistics, anecdotes, and more.

notes.claim: Outlines should be directly useful for drafting; you should be able to write major sections or paragraphs from the outline’s content.
notes.support: You should be able to look at your outline and write major sections or paragraphs using the information and ideas in your outline.

notes.claim: Level 1 bullet points cover the paper’s major topics and ideas.
notes.support: Level 1 bullet points should outline the major topics and ideas of your paper.

notes.claim: Level 2 bullet points plan sub-topics, supporting ideas, and organizational aspects.
notes.support: Level 2 bullet points should plan out sub-topics, supporting ideas, and organizational aspects of your essay.

notes.claim: Level 3 bullet points are optional and useful when you have extensive research to plan analysis for evidence or place counterarguments.
notes.support: Level 3 bullet points illustrate an extra level of thought and detail... if you have done a lot of research... use Level 3 bullet points to plan out your analysis for each piece of evidence or where to address specific counterarguments.

notes.claim: Including a references page after the outline is optional but helps organize sources before drafting.
notes.support: It is not always required, but it can be a good idea to include a references page after your outline. This way, your sources are already organized when you begin drafting your essay.

notes.claim: Full sentence outlines are often paired with an APA reference list on a separate page, and any quotes in the outline must use APA in-text citations.
notes.support: Full sentence outlines are often accompanied with an APA reference list on a separate page. Quotes within the outline must also utilize APA in-text citations.

notes.claim: The guide provides downloadable samples and templates, including a sample alphanumeric outline and an alphanumeric outline template.
notes.support: Sample Alphanumeric Outline... Alphanumeric Outline Template... Sample Outline... Outline Template... downloadable... to help you get started or understand what a completed outline could look like.

notes.claim: The guide was last updated on February 15, 2024 at 11:01 AM.
